That's more like it. I knew you would see sense.
It shall end this conflict forever.
We shall offer them the hospitality of the city. There need be no strife. We need not play host to the Destroyer of Delights.
Doctor?
Do as he says, Amy.
I shall ride at once. Prince Omar? We must ride for the desert road.
Come, Djinni. We must prepare a welcome.
As you wish.
My followers, we shall have guests. Alert the entertainers, fire up the kitchen, ready the dancers. Er, probably not the darats, though. Where is my Vizier?
Right then. Good. I'll just wait here then, shall I?
[OC]: Make yourself useful, Doctor. Find the Vizier.
(sighs) What did your last slave die of?
+ HASAN: 'Tis only on the culprit sin recoils. The ignorant fool against himself is armed. Humanity is sunk in wickedness. The best is he that leaveth us unharmed.
Hasan. Vizier. What are you doing out here?
Praying, Doctor. Join us.
It is our only hope.
For what?
To save us from the creature.
Oh, you mean the Djinni.
You have seen him too?
Don't worry about him. Everything will be well.
How can you say such a thing?
See those clouds of receding dust?
Horses' hooves?
Yes. Amy and Prince Omar riding out to greet the Legate of the Caliph.
Really? Then Omar need not defy his father.
That's right. We're all friends. So there will be no war, and the Legate shall come here in peace.
I would say that if one knew my Lord's predilection for gold, one would not offer such temptation.
What do you mean?
Well, the Legate of the Caliph...
Yes, he'll be here soon enough.
But he's been to other cities. He's left us till last.
He's been collecting taxes elsewhere?
For those that obey. We who have not obeyed shall be dealt with last of all.
The Legate's baggage train is full of other cities' taxes?
Yes.
Gold.
Well, yes, I Suppose so.
Of course!
Doctor? Doctor, where are you going?
Your Excellency.
What is it?
The city of Dunqulah is in sight.
Oh, good. I expect a right royal welcome.
You're not going to welcome the Legate. You're going to attack him.
Doctor, you really are very smart. Would you like a job as my Vizier? The one I have is very slow.
The Djinn use aurium for their warp manifolds.
Yes, that's right.
Heavy gold. You're going to make heavy gold by putting it in a mass compressor.
I leave the technical stuff up to him, but yes, I think that's more or less it.
The Legate's army has the last of the gold you need. You're going to steal it from him.
Yes.
At the point of a sword.
Well, something like that.
It will start a war. It will plunge this entire region into chaos.
That's what I do, isn't it? It's not like I asked the Legate to come here. Law is making its own fate. The forces of Law are walking right into this one.
I've seen the Legate's army. They are trained soldiers. They have siege weapons, catapults. If you attack them they will wipe this city out.
That would be true, Doctor, if the city only had human defenders.
The Djinni. You're going to use the Djinni.
My pilot is just as keen as I to leave this awful place. He shall help me.
What did you give to Amy? What did you give her?
A token of my esteem.
Don't lie to me.
Don't forget who you are addressing.
Oh, I know who you are all right. You've always been sneaky, but you've always been a bit...
Handsome?
Dull.
Oh.
You've always been waiting for someone else to do things for you, even your thinking.
What's your point, Doctor? I've forty things to do today.
I thought to myself, the Black Guardian, he can't use his own powers, what's the betting he can't use his own tricks? What if he has to steal someone else's ideas?
Like what exactly?
Do you think I don't remember the red crystal in Tegan's tiara? Placed there by Captain Wrack as a tracking device?
Oh, you remember that, do you?
That necklace, that jewel on that necklace.
Very shiny. Bit gaudy for my taste, but the slave seemed to like it.
That wasn't a jewel at all. That was a targeting device.
Oh, is that what that was? The Djinni called it a Jawahir.
If the Djinni has artillery on his ship, he'll be able to use the lure to aim his guns.
Oh, marvellous. That ought to do the trick, don't you think? Pinpoint accuracy.
With Amy as the target.
Oh, she'll save my whole domain.
And your son, Prince Omar? He'll die with her.
He'll be a hero too. And the bonus is, I won't have to have him killed for plotting against me.
I will stop you.
Oh, I don't think so. Guards!
Door slams.
There's no need to be so... What? I don't get my own cell? Be reasonable! Oh.
What are you in for?
For telling the truth.
Ah. One of those. Are you a storyteller?
No.
Pity. I could do with a laugh.
Hasan, do you think it is true?
The Doctor is a teller of unreliable tales.

I do not know.
It makes me wonder. Should I be loyal to the lord I have, or the lord I would have?
At last, the jailer. Hello! Is there any chance of some water?
Doctor.
Nisrin. Is that you?
Yes. Shh.
How did you sneak in here?
Slaves come and go everywhere within the palace. We are invisible unless we make a mistake.
How did you get in here?
It is assumed I am on official duties. No slave would dare disobey her lord, else she would meet the Destroyer of Delights.
But here you are anyway.
Unlocks door.
Cassim is my lord no longer. I serve Prince Omar, the lord that is to come. And by saving you, I will save his life.
Bless you, Nisrin.
Door opens.
What must we do?
The Djinni has some kind of artillery piece on his ship.
What is ar-tilleree?
A weapon that will take aim on the jewel Amy is carrying. I will try to turn her away from the Legate.
I will stop the ar-tilleree.
Er - you cannot, Nisrin, it is too dangerous.
I - I have seen inside the Djinni's cave, Doctor. He was too slow to catch Amy. I can distract him from operating this ar-tilleree.
Good, good. Go.
You are uncharacteristically silent, Amy.
I am sorry, Prince Omar.
What are you thinking?
You care for the thoughts of a slave?
Of course. I am not a monster.
Then perhaps you should care for the thoughts of Nisrin.
What do you mean?
She cares for you. You know she does. You know her love for you surpasses that of a slave for a master.
What is that shimmering in the distance? Is it a mirage?
No. No, it is the forces of the Legate. We are nearly there.
Don't drop that necklace now. Itll save us all.
We've given them enough time to reach the Legate. I think it's a good moment for you to set off your... thingy.
(unintelligible)
Powering it up now. It is ready.
Any time now would be good.
Better to fire later when the Jawahir is in the Legate's hands, than sooner when it is not.
You are so right. Don't leave it too long, though.
Come on. Why won't you go faster? I hate camels. Don't use that tone of voice with me. Come on, giddy up. Mush!
What brings you here?
I am Prince Omar, heir to the throne of Dunqulah. Amy, present the Legate with the gift of my father Lord Cassim.
Oh, that's very nice. Thank you. Does this mean that we're all friends and there isn't going to be any trouble?
Such is my father's tardy but welcome wish, your Excellency.
Oh, well. I'd brought catapults and soldiers and everything.
They will not be needed, your Excellency.
[OC]: Amy? Amy, don't give him the necklace. Get out of there.
Can you hear something?
Wait. It's the Doctor.
Come to claim the credit, no doubt. But fair play to him. If he has averted a war in the region, then he was true to his word.
The time has come. Open fire.
By your command. Target acquired. Achieving elevation. Target locked.
Fire!

NISRIN: Quickly, before the cave door closes. Amy. Amy. (door closes) Amy, I can not hold this door. Amy. Amy. Amy, get out of there. Amy, I said you were foolhardy. Now you face the Destroyer of Delights. Open this door.
COMPUTER: (unintelligible)

COMPUTER: (asks for password)

COMPUTER: (asks for password)

COMPUTER: (asks for password)

CASSIM: Take this jewelled necklace.
AMY: Oh my. It's lovely.
CASSIM: It's not for you, child. It is for the Legate of the Caliph. Ride with my son Omar. Ride out to the approaching soldiers, and present them with this token of my friendship.
DOCTOR: That's more like it. I knew you would see sense.
DJINNI: It shall end this conflict forever.
CASSIM: We shall offer them the hospitality of the city. There need be no strife. We need not play host to the Destroyer of Delights.
AMY: Doctor?
DOCTOR: Do as he says, Amy.
AMY: I shall ride at once. Prince Omar? We must ride for the desert road.
CASSIM: Come, Djinni. We must prepare a welcome.
DJINNI: As you wish.
CASSIM: My followers, we shall have guests. Alert the entertainers, fire up the kitchen, ready the dancers. Er, probably not the darats, though. Where is my Vizier?
DOCTOR: Right then. Good. I'll just wait here then, shall I?
CASSIM: [OC]: Make yourself useful, Doctor. Find the Vizier.
DOCTOR: (sighs) What did your last slave die of?
VIZIER: + HASAN: 'Tis only on the culprit sin recoils. The ignorant fool against himself is armed. Humanity is sunk in wickedness. The best is he that leaveth us unharmed.
DOCTOR: Hasan. Vizier. What are you doing out here?
HASAN: Praying, Doctor. Join us.
VIZIER: It is our only hope.
DOCTOR: For what?
VIZIER: To save us from the creature.
DOCTOR: Oh, you mean the Djinni.
HASAN: You have seen him too?
DOCTOR: Don't worry about him. Everything will be well.
VIZIER: How can you say such a thing?
DOCTOR: See those clouds of receding dust?
HASAN: Horses' hooves?
DOCTOR: Yes. Amy and Prince Omar riding out to greet the Legate of the Caliph.
HASAN: Really? Then Omar need not defy his father.
DOCTOR: That's right. We're all friends. So there will be no war, and the Legate shall come here in peace.
VIZIER: I would say that if one knew my Lord's predilection for gold, one would not offer such temptation.
DOCTOR: What do you mean?
VIZIER: Well, the Legate of the Caliph...
DOCTOR: Yes, he'll be here soon enough.
VIZIER: But he's been to other cities. He's left us till last.
DOCTOR: He's been collecting taxes elsewhere?
HASAN: For those that obey. We who have not obeyed shall be dealt with last of all.
DOCTOR: The Legate's baggage train is full of other cities' taxes?
VIZIER: Yes.
DOCTOR: Gold.
HASAN: Well, yes, I Suppose so.
DOCTOR: Of course!
HASAN: Doctor? Doctor, where are you going?
GUARD: Your Excellency.
WHITE GUARDIAN: What is it?
GUARD: The city of Dunqulah is in sight.
WHITE GUARDIAN: Oh, good. I expect a right royal welcome.
DOCTOR: You're not going to welcome the Legate. You're going to attack him.
BLACK GUARDIAN: Doctor, you really are very smart. Would you like a job as my Vizier? The one I have is very slow.
DOCTOR: The Djinn use aurium for their warp manifolds.
BLACK GUARDIAN: Yes, that's right.
DOCTOR: Heavy gold. You're going to make heavy gold by putting it in a mass compressor.
BLACK GUARDIAN: I leave the technical stuff up to him, but yes, I think that's more or less it.
DOCTOR: The Legate's army has the last of the gold you need. You're going to steal it from him.
BLACK GUARDIAN: Yes.
DOCTOR: At the point of a sword.
BLACK GUARDIAN: Well, something like that.
DOCTOR: It will start a war. It will plunge this entire region into chaos.
BLACK GUARDIAN: That's what I do, isn't it? It's not like I asked the Legate to come here. Law is making its own fate. The forces of Law are walking right into this one.
DOCTOR: I've seen the Legate's army. They are trained soldiers. They have siege weapons, catapults. If you attack them they will wipe this city out.
BLACK GUARDIAN: That would be true, Doctor, if the city only had human defenders.
DOCTOR: The Djinni. You're going to use the Djinni.
BLACK GUARDIAN: My pilot is just as keen as I to leave this awful place. He shall help me.
DOCTOR: What did you give to Amy? What did you give her?
BLACK GUARDIAN: A token of my esteem.
DOCTOR: Don't lie to me.
BLACK GUARDIAN: Don't forget who you are addressing.
DOCTOR: Oh, I know who you are all right. You've always been sneaky, but you've always been a bit...
BLACK GUARDIAN: Handsome?
DOCTOR: Dull.
BLACK GUARDIAN: Oh.
DOCTOR: You've always been waiting for someone else to do things for you, even your thinking.
BLACK GUARDIAN: What's your point, Doctor? I've forty things to do today.
DOCTOR: I thought to myself, the Black Guardian, he can't use his own powers, what's the betting he can't use his own tricks? What if he has to steal someone else's ideas?
BLACK GUARDIAN: Like what exactly?
DOCTOR: Do you think I don't remember the red crystal in Tegan's tiara? Placed there by Captain Wrack as a tracking device?
BLACK GUARDIAN: Oh, you remember that, do you?
DOCTOR: That necklace, that jewel on that necklace.
BLACK GUARDIAN: Very shiny. Bit gaudy for my taste, but the slave seemed to like it.
DOCTOR: That wasn't a jewel at all. That was a targeting device.
BLACK GUARDIAN: Oh, is that what that was? The Djinni called it a Jawahir.
DOCTOR: If the Djinni has artillery on his ship, he'll be able to use the lure to aim his guns.
BLACK GUARDIAN: Oh, marvellous. That ought to do the trick, don't you think? Pinpoint accuracy.
DOCTOR: With Amy as the target.
BLACK GUARDIAN: Oh, she'll save my whole domain.
DOCTOR: And your son, Prince Omar? He'll die with her.
BLACK GUARDIAN: He'll be a hero too. And the bonus is, I won't have to have him killed for plotting against me.
DOCTOR: I will stop you.
BLACK GUARDIAN: Oh, I don't think so. Guards!
DOCTOR: There's no need to be so... What? I don't get my own cell? Be reasonable! Oh.
PRISONER: What are you in for?
DOCTOR: For telling the truth.
PRISONER: Ah. One of those. Are you a storyteller?
DOCTOR: No.
PRISONER: Pity. I could do with a laugh.
VIZIER: Hasan, do you think it is true?
HASAN: The Doctor is a teller of unreliable tales.
VIZIER: But has Cassim sent Prince Omar to his doom?
HASAN: I do not know.
VIZIER: It makes me wonder. Should I be loyal to the lord I have, or the lord I would have?
DOCTOR: At last, the jailer. Hello! Is there any chance of some water?
NISRIN: Doctor.
DOCTOR: Nisrin. Is that you?
NISRIN: Yes. Shh.
DOCTOR: How did you sneak in here?
NISRIN: Slaves come and go everywhere within the palace. We are invisible unless we make a mistake.
DOCTOR: How did you get in here?
NISRIN: It is assumed I am on official duties. No slave would dare disobey her lord, else she would meet the Destroyer of Delights.
DOCTOR: But here you are anyway.
NISRIN: Cassim is my lord no longer. I serve Prince Omar, the lord that is to come. And by saving you, I will save his life.
DOCTOR: Bless you, Nisrin.
NISRIN: What must we do?
DOCTOR: The Djinni has some kind of artillery piece on his ship.
NISRIN: What is ar-tilleree?
DOCTOR: A weapon that will take aim on the jewel Amy is carrying. I will try to turn her away from the Legate.
NISRIN: I will stop the ar-tilleree.
DOCTOR: Er - you cannot, Nisrin, it is too dangerous.
NISRIN: I - I have seen inside the Djinni's cave, Doctor. He was too slow to catch Amy. I can distract him from operating this ar-tilleree.
DOCTOR: Good, good. Go.
OMAR: You are uncharacteristically silent, Amy.
AMY: I am sorry, Prince Omar.
OMAR: What are you thinking?
AMY: You care for the thoughts of a slave?
OMAR: Of course. I am not a monster.
AMY: Then perhaps you should care for the thoughts of Nisrin.
OMAR: What do you mean?
AMY: She cares for you. You know she does. You know her love for you surpasses that of a slave for a master.
OMAR: What is that shimmering in the distance? Is it a mirage?
AMY: No. No, it is the forces of the Legate. We are nearly there.
OMAR: Don't drop that necklace now. Itll save us all.
BLACK GUARDIAN: We've given them enough time to reach the Legate. I think it's a good moment for you to set off your... thingy.
COMPUTER: (unintelligible)
DJINNI: Powering it up now. It is ready.
BLACK GUARDIAN: Any time now would be good.
DJINNI: Better to fire later when the Jawahir is in the Legate's hands, than sooner when it is not.
BLACK GUARDIAN: You are so right. Don't leave it too long, though.
DOCTOR: Come on. Why won't you go faster? I hate camels. Don't use that tone of voice with me. Come on, giddy up. Mush!
WHITE GUARDIAN: What brings you here?
OMAR: I am Prince Omar, heir to the throne of Dunqulah. Amy, present the Legate with the gift of my father Lord Cassim.
WHITE GUARDIAN: Oh, that's very nice. Thank you. Does this mean that we're all friends and there isn't going to be any trouble?
OMAR: Such is my father's tardy but welcome wish, your Excellency.
WHITE GUARDIAN: Oh, well. I'd brought catapults and soldiers and everything.
OMAR: They will not be needed, your Excellency.
DOCTOR: [OC]: Amy? Amy, don't give him the necklace. Get out of there.
OMAR: Can you hear something?
AMY: Wait. It's the Doctor.
WHITE GUARDIAN: Come to claim the credit, no doubt. But fair play to him. If he has averted a war in the region, then he was true to his word.
BLACK GUARDIAN: The time has come. Open fire.
DJINNI: By your command. Target acquired. Achieving elevation. Target locked.
BLACK GUARDIAN: Fire!

elements.text: [Part Four]
Boom.
What was that?
The sound of thunder, here, in the desert?
Whoosh, boom nearby.
Someone is shooting at us.
Did something just fall out of the sky?
[OC]: Amy. Amy, you are danger.
How are we doing? Did that do the trick?
My ship has spent decades stuck in these sands. Time has worn at the weapon's mountings. I think the sights are off.
I did not wait a lifetime to be defeated by grains of sand. Fire again.
(unintelligible)
Firing.
There goes the thunder again.
Doctor, what is going on?
I do believe that somebody is shooting at me...
Everybody, get down, it's another attack!
Whoosh, boom.
Doctor, why is he doing this?
Where's the necklace? Quickly, the necklace!
We gave it to the Legate.
Panic in the camp.
This necklace. What has it got to go with anything? Hey. Hey, now, now, that was a gift.
It was a curse. This is a targeting lure.
GUARDIAN + OMAR: What?
It's a lure. A lure for the Destroyer of Delights.
Then we should get rid of it.
Take it far from here.
But how? There is no means of doing so.
The catapult. Pray one of the catapults is still working.
This way.
Surely that's done it?
Still off-target. I'll need to adjust a little.
Do hurry up.
No. Take as much time as you like. The longer the better.
What was that?
Another intruder.
How did you get on this ship?
Oh! Why can't you fools call this place a cave? Am I the only one here who speaks proper Arabic?
Nisrin, put that down. It's dangerous.
I'm counting on it.
Deal with her.
Nisrin, that is an energy weapon. It could kill you as easily as it could kill me.
Oh. As easily as you would kill Prince Omar, your own son.
A by-product of my imprisonment here. An accident of my exile. Be a good slave and...
I serve a new master, and you just tried to kill him.
Compensating. Taking aim.
You will not.
Blaster fires, Djinni cries out.
Quickly. Quickly. Wind it back.
Are you sure this will work?
The Djinni's ship is far away. This lure is the only means he has of finding our location.
But he's killed all my men. This catapult will not hold him off.
No. But it will fling the lure far from our position.
That's as far back as the windlass will go.
Good. Now Amy, put the necklace on the catapult.
Yes, Doctor.
Hurry up!
Stand back. Amy, back.
Omar, how does this work?
I pull this lever.
Then do it.
Whoosh.
Whoa-ho! Look at it go!
Far enough for you, Doctor?
Let's hope so.
You are holding a deadly weapon in a room full of electrical cable.
I don't care. I shall destroy your delights.
You fool, you'll kill us all.
Look out, it is a live cable.
(unintelligible)
What is that voice? Where is it coming from?
It's the fire alarm, stupid.
Alarm?
And this is what lightning feels like.
Zap. Nisrin cries out. Thud.
You killed her.
No. The shock was not big enough for that. I shall call a robot to dump her outside.
And shut off that alarm! Good, good. Now, can we please get on with this and kill everyone else.
I see now that my signal from the targeting lure was off by some eight hundred pazu. Compensating.
(unintelligible)
Firing!
There goes the thunder.
This had better work.
This is where we find out if I was right.
Doctor, is this fear?
Take my hand, Amy. It'll be fine.
Last time you said that...
Whoosh overhead, boom.
Ah ha! Missed.
(unintelligible)
What does that mean?
There is no signal from the Jawahir.
You destroyed it?
And whoever held it.
At last. My guards can fall upon the caravan to pick up the gold.
The time is past for the use of human servants.
But we need that gold carried into the ship.
I shall send my servants.
Everybody is dead. The soldiers are all dead.
We need to get out of here.
But the danger is past.
Seriously? The artillery barrage stops, and you think that's you safe?
Ah, well, I see your point.
Your Excellency, I assure you that this had nothing to do with me.
Clearly, else your father would have not sent you to your death.
You're right. He was ready to let me die.
Doctor, what should we do?
We should get out of the sun, get back to the city.
Doctor... Doctor? What are those?
Robots, from the ship.
Nisrin spoke of them. They are al-Rabat, servants of the Djinni.
They've come to take the gold.
We are safe, Doctor. They will not harm us.
This one seems intent on harming me. Back, back!
Leave it be, Prince Omar. It is - oh - oh!
They've been ordered to carry the survivors too.
No. Put me down. Put me down!
Doctor, it won't let me go.
I wouldn't worry about it.
Doctor, what do you mean?
I would very much like to get inside the Djinni's vessel, and this motorised transport is much more agreeable than riding on another camel.
You mean we should just give in and let them carry us?
The Doctor's right. It is much more comfortable than a camel.
Vizier! Vizier!
What?
The thunder has stopped.
Has the world ended?
Er, no, I don't think it has.
Then our prayers were answered.
As I thought. A long-range trading orbiter.
Are you the only survivors?
Your gunnery made sure of that, Guardian.
We aim to please.
You aimed to kill.
And yet you are still bafflingly alive.
You can let me go now I'm inside. You can let me go now.
So you are my adversary, my other half.
We're not married. Are we?
I don't think so.
Where is Omar? What have you done with Omar?
I decided to dump him outside with all the other trash. The rest of you are coming with me to search for that elusive segment of the Key to Time.
Where?
Once this ship is operational, the sky's the limit.
Well technically, the sky is merely a thin ribbon of atmosphere round the world so, you could say...
Are you always like this?
Let me in. Am I not a noble enough prisoner for you? (bangs on metal)
Master.
Nisrin.
Master?
Why are you here lying in the sand?
I tried to save you.
From what?
From the Tofang. The thing that sounded like thunder.
That was you?
I delayed them, but they threw me from their cave.
The cave is through that door?
Yes. It won't open.
Why would you go inside?
I would have words with that Djinni, and my father.
I can open it for you.
You can? Will the door obey you when it will not obey me?
I'm special. Open. Sim-sim.
(forbast?)
Door opens.
Nisrin, you have hidden talents.
I thought you would never notice, master.
Time to restore order, whether my father likes it or not.
Knowing your father, it's the last thing he wants.
Whirring machinery.
Well well, Lord Cassim. This place is a treasure trove.
You said it.
Not just gold, but jewels and treasures I cannot name.
Oh, I can.
I'm sure you can, Doctor.
It seems that this Djinn vessel was once very active in the surrounding star systems.
Look out, Doctor. More robots with gold.
That gold belongs to the Caliphate.
Oh, go to sleep. (whirr, thud) I win. Master of Reality, me.
Still more. Still more.
There is only one more load.
(forbast)
We have the correct mass.
We do? After all this time.
Shall I compress the gold?
Oh yes, do. Oh, thank the stars!
(unintelligible)
Look away, Amy.
What is it, Doctor?
Activating.
(forbast)
That's a mass converter. They're going to recombine the gold, fold it upon itself at the atomic level to make aurium.
Is that good?
If you want a warp manifold, yes.
Are you sure you know your way around this ship?
I'm doing my best, Mast... Ah ha!
What?
Come up to this glass, Master. You will be pleased with what you see.
What is it? Oh! The gold. All the gold in that huge chamber.
Why does it shine so?
Nisrin, you have found the lost gold.
But it is as if the gold is on fire.
Wait. Wait, what are they doing? It's shrinking.
Oh, look away, Master. It is as bright as the desert sun.
What are they doing?!
Where did all the gold go?
It's still there, Amy.
In a manner of speaking, yes, yes.
But it's all gone. It's been replaced with something else.
Oh Amy, you couldn't understand. This little shard of metal in my hand is not gold any more. This is aurium.
That's not what I meant. I meant...
This is the perfect catalyst for a spacecraft's warp manifold.
We must install it and leave this world.
Oh, yes, yes, we must. Come my dear Djinni, quickly.
Door opens and closes.
Doctor...
Forget it, Amy. It was only heavy gold.
No, Doctor. it was more than that, so much more.
Well, yes. They've got their warp manifold and so at least we can get off Earth, but that's not going to help.
I'm tingling.
Ah, try wriggling your fingers, that might...
I'm really tingling.
What? You mean... the aurium? That piece of heavy gold...
Is the fifth segment of the Key to Time.
They made it.
Is that possible? Surely the Black Guardian would have realised what he held?
Not until you convert it, Amy. Now I see. The Black Guardian was right all along.
He was?
He showed us those places where he thought he would find the segment but didn't. It's because the fifth segment was also beyond Time.
I'm not sure I understand, Doctor.
Every place the Black Guardian showed us was a place where the creation of the segment was imminent. He was on the right track, but it never occurred to him that he had to be there to make it happen.
Such a tiny little thing.
It takes a lot of gold to make a shard of aurium.
Even so, I would have expected it to be too heavy to lift. There must be a change at the atomic level.
Of course there... What was that?
Omar. How did you get in here?
Your magic cave obeys Nisrin.
It's true.
The door obeys any fool who knows the password.
Put the sword down, Omar, there's a good boy.
Where is the gold you have stolen?
The gold? Why, it's right here in my hand, Omar. All squashed down to make this wonderful piece of magic metal.
You destroyed my birthright. You have betrayed my people.
Your people?
You shall pay for this.
Master, look out.
You shall die! (power runs out) What?
Don't tell me you need new batteries?
The power has gone.
Not the power of my sword.
Several thrusts, the Djinni powers off.
I have seen such wonders this day.
No wonders here.
I have seen a Djinni.
And I have seen a Djinni die.
Wake up.
Is the White Guardian dead, Doctor?
No, just malingering. Wake up.
What did he do to me?
Just a stun gun. Don't be such a baby.
Get to your feet, quickly.
Oh, sorry. I am not speedy enough for you young things.
You stupid boy! That Djinni was the pilot of this ship. How can I get off-world now?
Master, is it not bad luck to slay a Djinni?
How do I know? There's no gold worth having in this metal cave. But perhaps the Djinni has silver, or something else. (door opens) Come, Nisrin.
Doctor, the Djinni is dead.
Omar, what have you done?
Give me that device. I want to give you a taste of your own medicine.
Sorry, all the charges have gone.
Then I'll just have to give you a slap.
Come on, then.
Stop it, you two. We have bigger problems.
I'm not afraid of the Djinni.
You should be. They are remarkably vengeful creatures.
It cannot trouble me from beyond the grave.
I wouldn't bet on that.
Will the Caliphate believe me, that this lump of metal is two years of gold mining?
I believe it.
Then here, Amy, take it. It's yours.
Thank you, Prince Omar.
Master, there is much treasure here that is not gold. Maybe we can use that to assuage the Caliph.
My thoughts exactly, Nisrin. Come.
Come back, you two. Don't go further in to the ship, it's dangerous.
For the last time, why do you keep calling this a ship?
(unintelligible)
What's that noise?
That voice? What does it mean?
Does anyone speak Djinni?
Why are you all looking at me?
I thought you knew everything, Doctor.
Right, no pressure, then.
It sounds like a sequence. I can hear words repeated.
That's what I'm afraid of. It's numbers.
Oh good, I thought it was something ominous.
I don't like it. I prefer things to be more random. Numbers implies law, implies rule.
It's a countdown.
That's not good, is it, Doctor?
Djinni are notoriously covetous. If a Djinni dies, he will take his whole ship with him.
A self-destruct sequence?
Fair play, it's what I'd do.
You are not helping.
Look, Nisrin. This room alone has enough silver to pay forty Caliphs.
We are saved?
I believe so.
But what is the chanting from the walls?
The Djinni's cave is alive. It mourns its master.
Are you not afraid it will avenge him?
Open this door.
Doctor, say the password.
Open, sim-sim.
Why isn't it working?
The Djinni overrode the codes. The airlock is...
Locked?
Well, what do we do?
Doctor, do something.
Listen to me. You are trapped within five dimensions until I save you.
No need to remind us, Doctor.
If you don't get off this ship you will die, understand?
Right.
There has to be one here somewhere.
One what?
Ah ha, here.
It's another jewel, like the one in the necklace.
This is a targeting lure.
Ah, like the one that nearly killed me.
Yes. Take it down to the end of the ship. The far end.
Why?
Because I'm going to fire the ship's projectile guns.
But they'll fire at the Jawahir. The ship will...
It will fire on itself. It could blow a hole in the hull.
That's what I'm hoping for.
Why are you giving it to him? Don't... don't you trust me?
Not really, no. Look, go with him if you must. Watch each other, share it, I don't care, but go!
Come on, then.
I'll make sure you do it properly.
And run!
This is it.
What a big chamber, and full of treasures. If you'd just given part of this to the Caliph, you would have been fine.
I never saw this chamber. It is the Djinni's, not mine. He must have acquired these artefacts on other worlds before I hired him to bring me here.
Yes. But it's the front of the ship, you can tell from the converging walls.
Oh yes. Doctor? Doctor, we've reached the far end of the ship.
[OC]: Throw it. Throw the lure.
Will do.
Throw it where?
I think he wants you to throw it at the far wall.
Why?
Because when he fires the gun it's going to target on the lure, and right now the lure iS...
Is... is in my hand. Oh, crikey.
Throw it, you fool! Get down!
(unintelligible)
Does that mean that there is power to the gun?
I hope so.
Can I press the button?
Oh, by all means.
Boom.
Did it work? Why didn't it hit the ship?
Amy, there are trajectories to work out, ups and downs and so on.
You mean the projectile is still in flight?
To hit something this close the gun would have had to fire practically straight up.
Oh, I see. And the projectile would take quite a while to...
To fall back down, yes.
KaBOOM.
Ouch! Oh, this ringing in my ears is going to stop sometime, right?
Oh, stop complaining.
My eyes! It's very bright.
Of course it's bright, it's the desert. Doctor? It worked. You've blown a hole in the hull.
Doctor, you've done it.
Get out of there, all of you! Get as far away from this ship as you can. Now, Amy, they're far enough away. Convert the aurium. Make the fifth segment.
He doesn't need to tell me twice.
Me neither. Come on.
The Doctor. He said we should flee.
Ignore him. Help me with these silver trinkets.
Master, he was quite insistent.
I am not leaving this cave without at least some of this treasure. This is mine, it should be mine.
But this is stealing.
Who is not stealing here? My father from his people? The Djinni from my father? The slave Amy from the Djinni? This cave has forty thieves, so why not join them?
Master, I risked my life for you. Now I will save my own.
Nisrin!
If you love me, follow me now.
Nisrin. Nisrin! Come back. Fine. Fine.
[OC]: Quickly, Master, if you value your life more than treasure.
I don't believe it. I am obeying a slave.
It is done.
The fifth segment. Quick, put it in the satchel.
Doctor, we should get off this ship too.
No Amy, this way.
But that's back into the ship.
Yes, Amy. Come on.
But the way out is back the way we came.
Yes Amy, I know, but I'm looking for something.
Doctor, this is not the time.
Oh, but it is, Amy. This is the last place it could be.
What could be?
My treasure. My only treasure. The Guardians followed it to Earth, to this place.
Followed what?
Something that I'm sure the Djinni would regard as eminently collectible. Ah ha.
The Tardis.
There you are, my beauty. Amy, help me clear this junk off it.
Will it work?
Will it work? What kind of question is that? It's lying on its side, but it won't be broken.
I don't mean that, I mean, well, it's not the best vehicle in the universe, is it?
Tardis door opens.
Lucky for you you can't hurt its feelings, not with a bomb about to go off. Inside, quickly.
It's good to be back home.
Doctor, will the Tardis survive the explosion?
I don't intend to stick around long enough to find out, Amy. Hang on!
Doctor, the countdown is in single digits.
Then we're lucky the Djinn have lots of fingers. Here goes.
Run. Run for it.
Wait!
We need to get further away from the ship.
Do you sense that?
Sense what? Yes. I can feel it.
A segment. Somehow the fifth segment is nearby.
The... the Doctor has the fifth segment. You don't think he would...? He wouldn't. Would he? The little...
Doctor!
(equivalent of two, one, zero.)
The Tardis dematerialises. KABOOM.
(laughs) We're safe!
No thanks to you, Master.
We are safe, and it is raining silver coins. Look, another. And another. Ow!
Master, take cover, quickly.
But treasures are falling from the sky.
Hard enough to kill you. Have you learned nothing? Quick, into this cave.
Whee, boom!
Nisrin, you are my better half, that much is true.
Master?
I think from now on, you can just call me Prince Omar.
Well, that's a start.
Doctor, you did it. We're safe.
We did it, Amy. I couldn't have managed without you. Now, let's see what we can do about finding the last piece of that key.
What a strange world that was.
What, Earth?
That was the strangest world I have ever seen.
Then be glad you can leave it behind. The Guardians are probably stuck there until we repair the Key to Time.
He found the segment. Where did he find it?
It must have been on the ship all along. But I don't sense it any more. The signal is lost again.
He has gone. He has deserted us, after all we did for him.
Does this mean we are successful? If we were, would we not have all our powers restored?
I was more than this. I laid waste to entire worlds. I needed that segment.
I too.
Now I am trapped on this world, within these dimensions.
We're all subject to a greater power, the Ruin of Vigour.
Who cannot be named.
I had power. I had power in incalculable measure, now I'm just a man.
The Doctor shall restore us. There is only one more piece to find. Only an idiot would fail to find the final segment.
Then we are all fortunate it is not your job to find it.
What's your point?
We should find shade. There's no telling how long we're going to be stuck here.
How long you will be stuck here, you mean, I shall return to my palace.
Powerless and despised? What fate awaits you, when Omar has the guards, and the throne, and the treasure? And the Caliphate shall put a price on your head.
I hadn't thought of that.
Maybe you haven't got all your marbles back after all.
I resent the implication.
Oh, resent all you like. Black and white, light and dark, law and chaos. It all rests on the Doctor now.
He shall choose my side, for I saved him.
Or he shall choose my side because I have never tried to kill him.
Oh no, no, no. My side, definitely.
What do you know? You couldn't even see a piece of the Key To Time on your own ship.
Neither could you.
